chapter.para: To get started with Doxygen-based documentation for your project you will create a docs directory under your project directory, and there create the Doxyfile configuration file.
You can also create any input or resource files that you may need in this directory.

section.title: Doxygen Configuration
section.para: This section identifies a few Doxgen configuration settings can consider.

simplesect.title: PROJECT_NAME
simplesect.para:
You can set PROJECT_NAME manually:
PROJECT_NAME = "My Project"

or have it automatically set, based on the name of the project directory as follows:
PROJECT_NAME = $(PROJNAME)

simplesect.title: OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
simplesect.para:
Set this to docs:
OUTPUT_DIRECTORY = docs

simplesect.title: FILE_PATTERNS
simplesect.para: Add the *.ino and *.S patterns to this list.

simplesect.title: USE_MDFILE_AS_MAINPAGE
simplesect.para:
This allows you to create a mainpage for your documentation that is written in Markdown. Something like this is good:
USE_MDFILE_AS_MAINPAGE = ./docs/README.md

section.title: Documenting Libraries
section.para: As well as being able to create whole project documentation, individual libraries can be separately documented.
This is done just as for projects, by creating a docs subdirectory within the library directory, and creating a suitable Doxyfile.
